title: Market Report Brazil Tourism Report Q4 2015 forecasts boom in room supply prior to 2016 Olympic Games
text:
(MENAFN Press) Fast Market Research announces the availability of a new Business Monitor International report "Brazil Tourism Report Q4 2015" on their comprehensive research portal.
Brazil is well on track for the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio which we expect to result in a surge of tourist arrivals. There will be a large number of hotel openings ahead of the Games boosting room supply although we expect expansion in the hotel sector to moderate after this point.
Brazil's tourist market is one of the largest in the region benefiting from the country's size which enables it to offer a variety of attractions including beaches city breaks Amazon adventures and mountain exploration. Although more expensive than many of its regional peers it is becoming increasingly popular among Latin American tourists. In addition a sustained marketing campaign plus the successful hosting of the FIFA World Cup in 2014 has expanded its international profile boosting arrivals from North America and Europe.
Get More Details on this Report and a Full Table of Contents at 
We hold a positive view on growth prospects in 2015-2016 with the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro expected to deliver a major boost to the industry. Preparations appear to be on schedule increasing confidence in the city's ability to host such a major sporting event. We are forecasting arrivals growth of 9.9% in 2016 as a result up from 4% in 2015. We expect this to feed through into higher tourist and transport receipts particularly in 2016. However the impact of this arrivals growth will not feed through into improved industry value which we expect to decline in both 2015 and 2016 despite the surge in tourist arrivals. We believe this is attributable to the wave of hotel expansion ahead of the 2014 World Cup which is forcing down prices at many hotels (previously extremely over-priced).
